content.description: Sit-start in the crack.  Move easily to the lip then rock over for a difficult mantel.
content.location: Northwest side of Iron Man Boulder.

content.description:
Stand-start using the crack underneath the start of Iron Man Traverse. Use the crack, rail, and eventually a flake to top out.

Called 'Unnamed V2' in the Young\Ryan guidebook. An uninspired name for a modest problem.
content.location: The obvious crack near the start of Iron Man Traverse.

content.description: Sit start matched on a diagnol crimp feature low on the arete. Find the body position and pull on to the wall. Move up to a small ripple-like crimp on the arete. Match hands and do one last big move then finish up on improving holds. Good movement with a scrunchy start and a couple of hard moves. Hit this one early in the morning or on a cold and heavily overcast day.
content.location: Right side of the Iron Man Wall. This is the arete that "The Iron Man Traverse" tops out on.

content.description:
Sit start at the left below some obvious sidepulls and traverse along the lip, using a number of slopers, crimps, foot chips, and heel-hookery.  Mantel over just before the far-right boulders.

Morning to early afternoon shade.
content.location: Northwest side of Iron Man Boulder.

content.description: Climb the obvious rail from left to right.  Easy moves provide encouragement, until the rail gets smaller near the end.  Good incuts and determination help gain the sloper out on the right lip.  Match on this and swing your right foot high and complete a classic.
content.location: South face of the 'Iron Man Boulder'

content.description: Start with hands matched on the rail, then bust out right through the crack. Rest up in the chimney, then finish up on Ironman.

Begin right of center on the 'Iron Man Traverse' rail (let the chalk on the lip guide you).

Two ways to do it:

1. Grab the rail, paste your feet and dyno to the lip, or...

2. Grab the rail, throw a heel, crank to a sloper and desperately bump along the lip to better holds. Both ways are pretty hard, and each is rad in its own right!
content.protection: A pad and a spot, especially for the dyno method.
content.location: A bit right of center on the 'Iron Man Boulder' - look for the chalk on the lip.

content.description: Climb Iron Man and instead of topping out, traverse back left using the lip for your hands and the rail for your feet. Finish on the crack.
